Description: Sheet of papyrus bearing a hieratic charm against ill health in favour of a man named Montemwenemef son of Neskhons with vignettes below in black outline showing a horned sun-disc, the throned Amun-Kamutef or Min holding a falcon, a falcon with flail, and Seth or Anubis spearing a serpent.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Curator's comments: Bibliography: Quack, J.F. 2022. Altägyptische Amulette und ihre Handhabung. Orientalische Religionen in der Antike 31. Tübingen, p. 123.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (381144) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/381144)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: good
